meanings.definition: A blindgut is a cul-de-sac or pouch at the beginning or end of the large intestine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the blindgut is a small pouch in the large intestine.
meanings.sent2: After the meal, the food moves through the blindgut to the rest of the digestive system.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about a blindgut that couldn't find its way out of the intestine!
meanings.sent4: The blindgut acted like a dead-end street, causing traffic jams in the digestive system.
meanings.sent5: The blindgut looked like a tiny pocket at the edge of the intestine.

meanings.definition: Blindgut can refer to a person who is ignorant or unperceptive.
meanings.sent1: She often felt like a blindgut when it came to understanding complex topics.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed the student's blindgut attitude towards learning new things.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his friend was a blindgut when it came to finding his way around town.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her a blindgut in recognizing other people's perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The blindgut in the group always missed the obvious details.
